tr.td: In programming APIs (not in communication between hosts), requests a system-allocated (dynamic) port[4][5]

td.style: background: #ececec; color: #2C2C2C; vertical-align: middle; font-size: smaller; text-align: center;

tr.td: TCP Port Service Multiplexer (TCPMUX). Historic. Both TCP and UDP have been assigned to TCPMUX by IANA,[1] but by design only TCP is specified.[6]
Secure Shell (SSH),[8] secure logins, file transfers (scp, sftp) and port forwarding
Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP),[8][22] used for email routing between mail servers
Resource Location Protocol (RLP)[25][importance?]—used for determining the location of higher level services from hosts on a network

a.title: Remote Mail Checking Protocol (page does not exist)

tr.td: Previously Interface Message Processor logical address management[citation needed]
Any private terminal access[further explanation needed]
Bootstrap Protocol (BOOTP) server;[8] also used by Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP)
Bootstrap Protocol (BOOTP) client;[8] also used by Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP)
Any private dial out service[further explanation needed]
Any private Remote job entry[further explanation needed]
Any private terminal link[further explanation needed]
dnsix (DoD Network Security for Information Exchange) Securit [sic?] Attribute Token Map[importance?]
Unassigned (with known unauthorized use[further explanation needed])[1]
ISO Transport Service Access Point (TSAP) Class 0 protocol;[47][48]
Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM; also port 11112)
IBM Systems Network Architecture (SNA) gateway access server
Open Network Computing Remote Procedure Call (ONC RPC, sometimes referred to as Sun RPC)
Ident, authentication service/identification protocol,[8][54] used by IRC servers to identify users
Authentication Service (auth), the predecessor to identification protocol. Used to determine a user's identity of a particular TCP connection.[55]
Network News Transfer Protocol (NNTP),[8] retrieval of newsgroup messages[57][58]
Network Time Protocol (NTP), used for time synchronization[8]
Formerly Unisys Unitary Login, renamed by Unisys to NXEdit. Used by Unisys Programmer's Workbench for Clearpath MCP, an IDE for Unisys MCP software development
Microsoft EPMAP (End Point Mapper), also known as DCE/RPC Locator service,[59] used to remotely manage services including DHCP server, DNS server and WINS. Also used by DCOM
NetBIOS Name Service, used for name registration and resolution[60][61]
Internet Message Access Protocol (IMAP),[8] management of electronic mail messages on a server[62]
Simple Gateway Monitoring Protocol (SGMP), a protocol for remote inspection and alteration of gateway management information[64]
Distributed Mail System Protocol (DMSP, sometimes referred to as Pcmail)[65][importance?]
Simple Network Management Protocol Trap (SNMPTRAP)[66][67][citation needed]
X Display Manager Control Protocol (XDMCP), used for remote logins to an X Display Manager server[68][self-published source]
Border Gateway Protocol (BGP),[69] used to exchange routing and reachability information among autonomous systems (AS) on the Internet
Mac OS X Server Admin[8] (officially AppleShare IP Web administration[1])
Mapping of Airline Traffic over Internet Protocol (MATIP) type A
cloanto-net-1 (used by Cloanto Amiga Explorer and VMs)
securecast1, outgoing packets to NAI's SecureCast servers[73]As of 2000[update]
Digital Equipment Corporation DECnet (Phase V+) over TCP/IP
NNSP, part of Network News Transfer Protocol
URL Rendezvous Directory for SSM (Cisco protocol)
tcpnethaspsrv, Aladdin Knowledge Systems Hasp services

tr.td: Internet Security Association and Key Management Protocol (ISAKMP) / Internet Key Exchange (IKE)[8]
Citadel, multiservice protocol for dedicated clients for the Citadel groupware system
FirstClass Protocol (FCP), used by FirstClass client/server groupware system
Remote Shell, used to execute non-interactive commands on a remote system (Remote Shell, rsh, remsh)
NetWare Core Protocol (NCP) is used for a variety things such as access to primary NetWare server resources, Time Synchronization, etc.
OSIsoft PI (VMS), OSISoft PI Server Client Access

HTTP RPC Ep Map, Remote procedure call over Hypertext Transfer Protocol, often used by Distributed Component Object Model services and Microsoft Exchange Server
Reliable Syslog Service — used for system logging
TUNNEL profile,[78] a protocol for BEEP peers to form an application layer tunnel
ASF Remote Management and Control Protocol (ASF-RMCP) & IPMI Remote Management Protocol
Common Unix Printing System (CUPS) administration console (extension to IPP)

Label Distribution Protocol (LDP), a routing protocol used in MPLS networks
SupportSoft Nexus Remote Command (data), a proxy gateway connecting remote control traffic

IBM RMC (Remote monitoring and Control) protocol, used by System p5 AIX Integrated Virtualization Manager (IVM)[82] and Hardware Management Console to connect managed logical partitions (LPAR) to enable dynamic partition reconfiguration
Mac OS X Server administration,[1] version 10.4 and earlier[8]
airserv-ng, aircrack-ng's server for remote-controlling wireless devices
IEEE Media Management System over SSL (IEEE-MMS-SSL)[83]
Extensible Provisioning Protocol (EPP), a protocol for communication between domain name registries and registrars (RFC 5734)
Link Management Protocol (LMP),[84] a protocol that runs between a pair of nodes and is used to manage traffic engineering (TE) links

Cisco Tag Distribution Protocol[88][89][90]—being replaced by the MPLS Label Distribution Protocol[91]

Remote HTTPS management for firewall devices running embedded Check Point VPN-1 software[99]
Internet Message Access Protocol over TLS/SSL (IMAPS)[8]

td.span:
This section contains information of unclear or questionable importance or relevance to the article's subject matter. Please help improve this section by clarifying or removing superfluous information. If importance cannot be established, the section is likely to be moved to another article, pseudo-redirected, or removed.
Find sources: "List of TCP and UDP port numbers" – news · newspapers · books · scholar · JSTOR · free images (August 2016) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)

data.p: The range of port numbers from 1024 to 49151 are the registered ports. They are assigned by IANA for specific service upon application by a requesting entity.[1] On most systems, registered ports can be used without superuser privileges.
This is an incomplete list of notable ports. See the Service Name and Transport Protocol Port Number Registry of IANA for the complete list of assigned ports.

tr.td: Native IPv6 behind IPv4-to-IPv4 NAT Customer Premises Equipment (6a44)[103]
nim, IBM AIX Network Installation Manager (NIM)
nimreg, IBM AIX Network Installation Manager (NIM)
rmiactivation, Java remote method invocation (RMI) activation
rmiregistry, Java remote method invocation (RMI) registry
Battle.net chat/game protocol, used by Blizzard's games[104]
The cajo project Free dynamic transparent distributed computing in Java
VLC media player default port for UDP/RTP stream[citation needed]
Microsoft System Center Operations Manager (SCOM) (formerly Microsoft Operations Manager (MOM)) agent

tr.td: Early deployment of RADIUS before RFC standardization was done using UDP port number 1645. Enabled for compatibility reasons by default on Cisco[citation needed] and Juniper Networks RADIUS servers.[116] Official port is 1812. TCP port 1645 must not be used.[117]

Old radacct port,[when?] RADIUS accounting protocol. Enabled for compatibility reasons by default on Cisco[citation needed] and Juniper Networks RADIUS servers. Official port is 1813. TCP port 1646 must not be used.[117]
